title: Learning to Walk Structured Text Networks CMU-LTI-08-002
abstract: We propose representing a text corpus as a labeled directed graph, where nodes represent words and weighted edges represent the syntactic relations between them, as derived by dependency parsing. Given this graph, we adopt a graph-based similarity measure based on random walks to derive a similarity measure between words, and also use supervised learning to improve the derived similarity measure for a particular task. Empirical evaluation of the approach on the task of coordinate term extraction shows that the suggested framework improves on a state-of-the-art distributional similarity measure.
